text: I found this one a little overhyped myself. Still had a decent time with it, but it wasn't that scary.

author: animefanatic777

text:
Be very scared. If I don't give you any spoilers, I can't tell you what to expect. That's how much stuff is in this game.

Also, I'd highly recommend "liteCam 100FPS Game Capture" on Steam. I bought it on sale, but it's still worth it to buy it at full price. Its charms outweigh its bad points, in my opinion.Â http://store.steampowered.com/app/269290/

author: GeoGyf

text: Sounds like a horror classic. To be honest though, I really don't like the music where you're being chased by the guy who calls you "Little Pig", because I find it to be kinda cheesy.
author: Medal Melodies

text: I'm usually not the biggest fan of survival horror games where you can only run away without being able to defend yourself, but Outlast did it right. The whole nightvision camera mechanic was simply perfect, I knew I was in for some scary time when I first turned it on and saw how realistic it felt. There were moments where I'd arrive at a door to a pitch black room and I'd just stand there, convincing myself to step inside with only the disorienting camera guiding you, making it feel quite claustrophobic. With its very oppressive atmosphere, I find a horror game that can often make me think "Wow, I'm glad I'm finally out of this room/floor/sequence" to be memorable and effective.
author: SupraDarky

text: Look at the Rule Of Rose ost, some fantastic music. Also a fantastic game.
